ux-text.title: Writing UX text for spinners
ux-text.section-content: Loading spinners give users visual feedback that something is happening. A short, polite message like “Please hold, it could take a few minutes” can help reduce frustration or confusion. Especially if it might take a little while.

columns.title: Keep it calm and polite
columns.content: Avoid phrases like _Loading…_ or _Just a moment…_ on their own – they can feel vague or dismissive. A polite, neutral tone works best.

columns.title: Set expectations if needed
columns.content:
If the delay is expected due to technical reasons (e.g. checking bank details or retrieving data), it's helpful to let users know upfront.

Example:

Please hold – we’ve received your details and are reviewing them now. This may take a few minutes.

columns.title: Avoid unnecessary detail
columns.content: Don’t over-explain what’s happening in the background – keep it brief and focused on what the user needs to know.
